column8:
Routines

Athletes & busy professionals need to pay attention to their morning and night routines.

Having a Game Plan for these routines will drive productivity throughout the day.

Educating my athletes in these areas was a very challenging part of my role in athletics. Especially with 18-22 year olds and the demands associated with high level athletics. 

But when they applied these concepts into their daily routines, their performance in the class room, and in training, improved significantly. 

Watching them compete and win on game day, after dialing in their lifestyle Game Plan was extremely rewarding. 
Here are a few simple to follow rules to start applying right away:

ðŸŒ¤ï¸Morning sunlight as soon as you wake
â˜•ï¸Limit caffeine upon waking
ðŸ“±Turning off the screens leading up to bed
ðŸ’¡Dim lights at night 
ðŸ›€Hot bath/shower 1 hour before sleep 
ðŸ›Œ Bat cave bedroom 

Win your day, to win your night.

This will positively impact your training, nutrition, stress levels, and relationships.

Win your day, win your night, win your life.

column8:
I know James Elfer was just wondering out loud, but it got me thinking as well. What if teams couldn't hire if psych safety levels were below a certain level?

This is a fascinating thought experiment. 

The cynical me, believes that magically, somehow, the #s would go up. Magically, psychological safety levels would be reported as high. This could happen for a number of reasons, including people thinking "Unless these #s go up, we will not hire people, and I am overloaded!"

But other things. Say the # was low. Would that cause an immediate blame game? If psychological safety is low, it is perhaps unreasonable to imagine that the team would be able address the issue to improve the #s. 

Or you could imagine a situation where the team and its leaders were doing its best, and the issue was somewhere else, somewhere higher. I doubt that would get worked out. 

What else?

Entergy Texas appreciates the tremendous support and patience from our customers and communities.

As part of these efforts, we are marking a significant milestone in our journey towards digital transformation - the establishment of our Mars Petcare Digital Advisory Board.â€¯Comprising experts from industry, policy, and academia, it will bring valuable insights and challenge our thinking in this space. 
 
But what does this mean for our Associates? It means having the opportunity to learn at pace from some of the industryâ€™s best and brightest, build on a strong foundation of growth and harness the power of this insight and experience to make a real difference to pets and the people who care for them.

Yesterday, I had the incredible honor to carry the Olympic TorchÂ in Paris,Â receiving it from a fellow Sanofian @Dominique Veron.
It was a once in a lifetime experience for me and one which I treasure even more given my Greek heritage. It proved a powerful reminder of the spirit of unity and perseverance that defines the Olympic Games. 
Just as the Olympic & Paralympic Games bring together people from all walks of life, at Sanofi, we are working every day to be a company that is reflective of the people and communities we serve. As a member ofÂ the Sanofi Executive Committee and the @Sanofi DE&I board, I am committed to building a culture of representative leadership and fostering an environment where our people can bring their best selves to work.
I am also proud that Sanofi is leveraging its partnership with the Games to support others in their quest to make an impact on society and want to give a special shoutout to my friend Dany Dann from Team Sanofi who I will be cheering on from the sidelines in just a few days.

ðŸŽ‰Â UnitedHealthcare is streamlining healthcare by transforming how members find care and achieve assurance through cost certainty. We're thrilled to unveil our new provider search for 27 million commercial members, a result of a two-year collaboration across 40 teams, designed to help members easily locate relevant, high-quality, and cost-effective care.
 
Over seven years ago, my wife faced challenges during her pregnancy and we were confronted with the harsh reality of navigating in-network and out-of-network providers, which led to unexpected financial burdens. This experience was a wakeup call which sparked a personal commitment: No one should have to sacrifice their dreams while caring for a loved one. Healthcare should be simple, straightforward, and supportive.
 
The new provider search experience is live for both web and app and includes:

ðŸ” ðŸ‘ª Member-specific search: Members can now search for care tailored to specific family members, ensuring personalized healthcare solutions.

ðŸ’¡ðŸ§  Claims-aware search: Leverages AI and ML to surface the most relevant providers based on the services they provide, streamlining the search process.

ðŸ‘¨ðŸ½â€âš•ï¸x ðŸ‘©ðŸ¾â€âš•ï¸ Side-by-side provider comparison tool: This allows members to compare providers based on their preferences, making informed decisions easier than ever.

ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ Patient reviews powered by Healthgrades: Gain insights from other patients to help choose the right provider.

ðŸ’²Integrated cost estimates: Provides financial clarity on services provided by different healthcare professionals.

ðŸ¥‡Best match search logic and enhanced filters: Surface the highest value and most cost-efficient providers, optimizing healthcare spending.

ðŸ©º PCP selector: Helps members find and manage their primary care providers for themselves and their dependents.

ðŸ—ºï¸ ðŸ“Map view: An interactive map to search for providers, helping members find convenient care options.

ðŸ“§ ðŸ–¨ï¸ Share, print, and download provider feature: Offers flexibility in how members can use and share provider information.

When trying out a new product for something as important as sun protection, itâ€™s important to know the details. At Kenvue, we earn trust with science, and this new light texture moisturizer is now available exclusively in Germany and the United Kingdom. 
 
So, what's in it to make this all work? Vitamin C, E, and B3 vitamins strengthen the skin barrier, induce collagen production, and help to prevent visible aging. It alsoÂ delivers 12 hours of deep hydration and SPF50 protection without any white residue.
 
Hydration boosters provide all-day hydration, with hyaluronic acid working together with collagen fibers to make skin softer, firmer and more uniform, as well as panthenol, capable of attracting water molecules to prevent the skin from losing water, and glycerin which goes beyond the superficial into deeper layers to ensure smooth skin.
 
All that in one product! Weâ€™re proud of these innovations and consumers agree, with 98% reporting more hydrated skin. Have you added SPF protection to your routine?
 
#WeAreKenvue #KenvueScience

I'm now out of Honduras's warm central region and in the currently temperate and rainy mountains near Nicaragua. I'm drinking a mocha made from locally grown coffee and a distinctive Criollo cacao variety- fermented and artisanally processedâ€”farm-to-bar style. It is uniquely flavorful in ways commodity-grown and bulk-blended coffee and chocolate cannot. Unfortunately, the region's fermented beverages (excluding beer) are not as widely complimentary in quality. Still, there is optimism about eventual marketability and improvements to the lives of regional small-scale farmers/cooperatives with diversification and value-added options. Cacao mucilage fermentation and distillates are intriguing. Hopefully, my limited involvement over the last few years may leave a beneficial impact.

Almost 5 years in the energy and utilities industry and Iâ€™ve only just got to my first thermal generation power stationðŸ”¥ It was a brilliant day learning more about how Drax have converted 4 of their combustion units to fire biomass, shifting from coal towards more lower carbon power generation. Also fabulous to see our National Grid 400kV substation at Drax, connecting customers ðŸ”Œ Big thank you to Chris Orr for organising a fantastic day of learning! 

5 fun facts today :

âš¡ï¸Drax have their own trains and a direct to site railway line that transports all the biomass wood pellets in to site, this biomass comes all the way from the US and Canada

âš¡ï¸The circulating water that is output underneath the large cooling towers is around 30 degrees, a lovely warm shower temperature - wonder if there are any waste heat harnessing opportunities here!

âš¡ï¸Although Drax has shifted away from coal combustion, the left over pulverised coal ash is now providing environmental net gain benefits as a nature reserve, sustainability is more than just decarbonisation!

âš¡ï¸Drax store about a weekâ€™s worth of generation wood pellets on site, reserving about ~25MW of the electricity they generate to power their site operations

âš¡ï¸The biomass storage dome facilities were constructed by inflating the same material that is used in bouncy castles, and it was inflated outwards, creating a door for construction operations to enter inside the inflated dome and reinforce the dome with steel and concrete

The numbers are really tremendous â€“ our customers avoided over 2.8 million metric tons of lifetime greenhouse gas emissions last year by participating in our #energyefficiency programs and #decarbonization efforts. Thatâ€™s the equivalent of over 6.4 million consumed barrels of oil. The latest Eversource Energy Sustainability Report highlights our organizational focus on ESG and the on-the-ground efforts for getting it done: 
 
Our Massachusetts Main Streets program for small businesses deployed 60% of its 2023 events in Environmental Justice communities; our smart thermostat ConnectedSolutions program grew by 27% last year and engagedÂ over 60,000 customers in demand response;Â and our net zero new construction programs enrolled 33 net zero or net zero ready, ultralow energy use new buildings, representing over 3.7 million square feet of space. 
 
Beyond EE, this report shares some important Eversource-wide initiatives, including how our Grid Modernization team is implementing measures to dynamically manage an increasingly complex power grid. It also outlines the efforts of our Solar team to support more than 160,000 Eversource customers who installed over 2,600 MW of customer-sited solar by the end of 2023. 
 
Iâ€™m grateful to work alongside so many talented individuals powering these significant improvements, including Brandy A. Chambers, Jennifer Gray, Katherine W. Peters, Nelson Medeiros, CEM, Richard Kazarian, Ron Araujo, and Stephen Bruno. Read more here about how weâ€™re driving towards a #cleanenergy future: https://lnkd.in/e4WpQnae 
 
#sustainability #TeamEversource

Enterprise SaaS Net New Name selling 101:

1ï¸âƒ£ This is a business motion, not a sales motion...leave your sales process at the door

2ï¸âƒ£ There is almost never budget waiting for you, but there is almost always cash/FCF...this is your funding source

3ï¸âƒ£ You are not in their operating plan, this is about giving them a reason to make your assets a part of it...which is almost always financial

4ï¸âƒ£ This is about business guidance, not sales discovery (primarily because of the above two points)

5ï¸âƒ£ Always sell your cash flow impact first

6ï¸âƒ£ No matter how compelling your financials, you are asking them to start a project that is not in their operating plan, now, therefore the burden falls on you to articulate the scope, work breakdown, stakeholder requirements and critical path...this is the second of their two critical decisions if this is going to work

7ï¸âƒ£ Companies must allocate their capital to intermediate/long term assets to ensure that growth and shareholder/stakeholder value are optimized...SaaS can and must be sold this way if you want to source and close strategic revenue

8ï¸âƒ£ NNN selling starts with a strategic business idea, not a product or solution

9ï¸âƒ£ This is supposed to be hard...embrace it, this is just a higher order skill

ðŸŽ‰Â UnitedHealthcare is streamlining healthcare by transforming how members find care and achieve assurance through cost certainty. We're thrilled to unveil our new provider search for 27 million commercial members, a result of a two-year collaboration across 40 teams, designed to help members easily locate relevant, high-quality, and cost-effective care.
 
Over seven years ago, my wife faced challenges during her pregnancy and we were confronted with the harsh reality of navigating in-network and out-of-network providers, which led to unexpected financial burdens. This experience was a wakeup call which sparked a personal commitment: No one should have to sacrifice their dreams while caring for a loved one. Healthcare should be simple, straightforward, and supportive.
 
The new provider search experience is live for both web and app and includes:

ðŸ” ðŸ‘ª Member-specific search: Members can now search for care tailored to specific family members, ensuring personalized healthcare solutions.

ðŸ’¡ðŸ§  Claims-aware search: Leverages AI and ML to surface the most relevant providers based on the services they provide, streamlining the search process.

ðŸ‘¨ðŸ½â€âš•ï¸x ðŸ‘©ðŸ¾â€âš•ï¸ Side-by-side provider comparison tool: This allows members to compare providers based on their preferences, making informed decisions easier than ever.

ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ Patient reviews powered by Healthgrades: Gain insights from other patients to help choose the right provider.

ðŸ’²Integrated cost estimates: Provides financial clarity on services provided by different healthcare professionals.

ðŸ¥‡Best match search logic and enhanced filters: Surface the highest value and most cost-efficient providers, optimizing healthcare spending.

ðŸ©º PCP selector: Helps members find and manage their primary care providers for themselves and their dependents.

ðŸ—ºï¸ ðŸ“Map view: An interactive map to search for providers, helping members find convenient care options.

ðŸ“§ ðŸ–¨ï¸ Share, print, and download provider feature: Offers flexibility in how members can use and share provider information.

Quick reflection on our 1st Half FY24 at EchoStor Technologies. No surprises here: Record revenue and YoY growth, a tremendous influx of new customers that have trusted our team and mission, the launching of several strategic/high-growth partnerships such as NVIDIA and several notable Cloud Security market leaders, the continued support from an enterprise-class professional services and managed services team, and the execution from our exceptional field sales and marketing teams that operate with transparency, teamwork and a passion for the overall customer experience. 

Weâ€™ve continued to build a world-class Innovation team of industry technology leaders that have launched an impressive GTM in the Generative AI space to help productivity, support and empower our customers along their extraordinary AI journeys ahead. Weâ€™ve exceeded revenue growth expectations with a well-balanced portfolio across our core technology pillars, specifically Next Gen Data Center, Enterprise Networking, Security, Microsoft Consulting and ServiceNow; providing our customer's with a truly unified platform of services. And we've doubled-down on our geographic expansion initiative to move southeast, with our recent Tri State expansion as the blueprint for future success. 

Aside from the historic individual and team performances, our mission remains clear: Continue to surround our customers with A+ customer service and go the extra mile. There are many â€œvendorsâ€ in the channel community, but being a proactive, informative, and trustworthy business partner is unique. One that cares and values the transformation and success of their customers, while considered an extension of their collective team(s) has been the key to our success. 
 
Thank you to all of our incredible customers and business partners. Thank you to our Executive Team and all of our great employees, as it takes a full roster to fuel the rocketship, and the credit goes to all of you. Looking forward to continuing this run in the 2nd Half! 

#EchoStor #CustomerFirst

By joining forces with the National Council for Mental Wellbeing, we aim to empower mental health providers with our cutting-edge AI-driven technology, designed to proactively identify, triage, and monitor at-risk patients using advanced linguistic, audio, and video analysis.

Why is this important? With 1 in 5 U.S. adults experiencing mental illness annually and a 93% burnout rate among mental health workers, the need for innovative solutions is undeniable. Our platform not only supports patients but also alleviates the burden on providers by streamlining administrative tasks and enhancing patient outcomes.

Born in Panama City on July 16, 1948, Ruben Blades has become an icon in Latino music. Blades moved from Panama to New York City in 1974 to pursue a music career. He began in the mailroom at Fania Records and later became a noted songwriter and singer for Ray Barretto and Larry Harlow. His groundbreaking album Siembra, featuring Blades' signature song "Pedro Navaja," was released with Willie ColÃ³n in 1978. Siembra remains one of the best-selling salsa albums of all time and a cornerstone of the genre.

But Blades' talents don't stop at music! He holds a law degree and has made significant strides as an actor, appearing in films and TV shows like "The Milagro Beanfield War" and "Fear the Walking Dead." He even ventured into politics, running for the presidency of Panama in 1994 and serving as the country's Minister of Tourism from 2004 to 2009.

I was excited to read this Digiday article about RMNs based on its title and although I liked the piece, it left out a large point: the significant amount of margin/profit that media networks make relative to their owners' legacy businesses. It's a BIG difference.

There's nothing wrong with making profits and it probably brings some healthy competition to the performance digital space, but it does raise the question of how the RMN space grows and sustains in the coming years if its only about maximizing profit? 

These networks may or may not realize it, but they are kind of getting into the publishing game. Some of that profit needs to be invested in to audience building tactics to drive growth and engagement on their properties. Otherwise RMNs simply become a play to harvest intent focused ad dollars with text ads. That will exhaust fairly quickly.

In short, if 'everything is an ad network', what does that mean for the experience of digital consumers? 

#RMN #CommerceMedia #adnetworks

column8:
ðŸŽ‰Â UnitedHealthcare is streamlining healthcare by transforming how members find care and achieve assurance through cost certainty. We're thrilled to unveil our new provider search for 27 million commercial members, a result of a two-year collaboration across 40 teams, designed to help members easily locate relevant, high-quality, and cost-effective care.
 
Over seven years ago, my wife faced challenges during her pregnancy and we were confronted with the harsh reality of navigating in-network and out-of-network providers, which led to unexpected financial burdens. This experience was a wakeup call which sparked a personal commitment: No one should have to sacrifice their dreams while caring for a loved one. Healthcare should be simple, straightforward, and supportive.
 
The new provider search experience is live for both web and app and includes:

ðŸ” ðŸ‘ª Member-specific search: Members can now search for care tailored to specific family members, ensuring personalized healthcare solutions.

ðŸ’¡ðŸ§  Claims-aware search: Leverages AI and ML to surface the most relevant providers based on the services they provide, streamlining the search process.

ðŸ‘¨ðŸ½â€âš•ï¸x ðŸ‘©ðŸ¾â€âš•ï¸ Side-by-side provider comparison tool: This allows members to compare providers based on their preferences, making informed decisions easier than ever.

ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ Patient reviews powered by Healthgrades: Gain insights from other patients to help choose the right provider.

ðŸ’²Integrated cost estimates: Provides financial clarity on services provided by different healthcare professionals.

ðŸ¥‡Best match search logic and enhanced filters: Surface the highest value and most cost-efficient providers, optimizing healthcare spending.

ðŸ©º PCP selector: Helps members find and manage their primary care providers for themselves and their dependents.

ðŸ—ºï¸ ðŸ“Map view: An interactive map to search for providers, helping members find convenient care options.

ðŸ“§ ðŸ–¨ï¸ Share, print, and download provider feature: Offers flexibility in how members can use and share provider information.

Thank you, UHC members, for your trust and for being part of our family. Your health is our priority, and we're honored to enhance your experience with new features on the UHC app and myuhc.com.

We appreciate every team member's role in this milestone. While listing all 300+ contributors isn't possible here, I wanted to thank key individuals. Taiss Lewis, thank you for your resilience and leadership! Also thank you to Ryan Bartell Julie Chaloner Jen Mahoney Erika Santiago Anees Azeez Zachary Crnecki Sunita Patolia, PharmD, PhD Samantha Baker Amy Jordan Tracy (Gottlieb) Bassett Michel Claussen Nicole Hunt Mike Litecky Bridget Feickert Syed Munir Hassan Jerry Koepp Sathya Y. #Healthcare #teamwork

#AI for social goodðŸ‘¥

From eradicating poverty and hunger to providing quality education, the world has ambitious targetsâ€”the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)â€”to achieve by 2030. 

As of 2024, with only six years remaining, weâ€™re on track to meet just 15% of these goals. Around 750 million people currently face hunger, and 2.2 billion people lack access to safe water and hygiene.

A recent report by McKinsey & Company highlights AIâ€™s potential to help achieve the SDGs. Early-stage health diagnosis or optimized food distribution are just a few areas where AI can make a significant impact.

ðŸ‘‰ðŸ¼AI already has a considerable presence in the social sectors: 66% of not-for-profit organizations use AI, and 80% believe they would benefit from more. 
ðŸ‘‰ðŸ¼ 72% state that most efforts to deploy AI for social good have centered on research and innovation.
ðŸ‘‰ðŸ¼ Organizations aiming to scale AI face challenges, including #data quality and accessibility (73%), talent availability (48%), and organizational receptiveness (43%). 

We can address these challenges through effective collaboration, creating high-quality data sets, and developing #digital public goods, such as software, standards, and content.

The potential risks and rewards of AI are two sides of the same coin. However, the substantial increase in its use cases positions AI as a key enabler. 

Do you believe we can successfully leverage AI for social goodâ“

Mars Petcare is a proof that incumbents can innovate, grow and disrupt. From leading the pet food categoryÂ since 1935 to a business like no other in the consumer space - that spansÂ specialty and therapeutic nutrition, primary and specialty care, veterinary and at-home diagnostics, and digital platforms. 
 
Time to stop and celebrate? No way! We have only scratched the surface of transforming the experience of pet ownership. So, what do we do now?Â Accelerate. 

To move faster, build cheaper and make bigger, we need an even better use of end-to-end digital capabilities. I am excited about our new Digital Advisory Board that will support this journey. A group of rockstars from across industry, policy and academia that are going to bring guidance, experience and a lot of challenge. For my entire 30 year career, Iâ€™ve heard it said that â€œour system is not sustainable.â€ My question now is how can something so â€œunsustainableâ€ be sustained for so long? WPP and GroupM have always been special to me. In many ways, I grew up there. 

Following the acquisition of 24/7 Real Media in 2007, I would spend the next ten years in the group - learning, building, innovating, making mistakes, and ultimately achieving great things. I became a pretty good product manager, a first-time CEO, and a successful media executive. Along the way, I came to admire the culture of invention, drive, client focus, and collaboration at GroupM.

In equal measure, I gained perspective during seven years outside the group. I worked for the worldâ€™s largest telco, and was part of a now epic transformation of AT&T. I became a seller instead of a buyer. I built and ran a pre-revenue technology company, with all of the thrills and challenges that are unique to startups. This time was invaluable.

The core purpose remained unchanged: building innovative businesses that drive marketing and advertising forward.

I am thrilled to return to GroupM as Global CEO.

There is no better place to innovate, do great work, learn from clients and colleagues, and help the worldâ€™s largest advertisers navigate an ever-changing media landscape. Thank you to Mark Read and the WPP board for this awesome opportunity. Thank you to Christian Juhl for laying a great foundation and for a seamless handover.

To my soon-to-be colleagues at GroupM, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Wavemaker, choreograph, and Nexus, I canâ€™t wait to work with you! I start on September 15. 

Iâ€™m back and Iâ€™m energized! Letâ€™s go!

The Delaware County Chamber of Commerce is pleased to announce the appointment of Matthew Rhodes, Executive Vice President â€“ Strategy & Corporate Development at Essential Utilities, Inc. itâ€™s Board of Directors. 
 
"It is an honor and a privilege to join the Delaware County Chamber of Commerce.Â Iâ€™m especially thrilled for the opportunity to serve a community so important to me, both personally and professionally. As the Executive Vice President, Strategy and Corporate Development for Essential Utilities, I am proud to say our companyâ€™s roots run deep right here in Delaware County." said Rhodes. "Our subsidiary, Aqua, was founded here nearly 140 years ago. Since 1886, as our company has grown and evolved, so has our commitment to the people in this community. I am looking forward to carrying that commitment into this new role with the Chamber, and working together to create a better, stronger Delaware County."
 
Matthew Rhodes is executive vice president, strategy and corporate development for Essential Utilities, Inc. (NYSE: WTRG), one of the largest publicly traded water, wastewater and natural gas providers in the U.S., serving approximately 5 million people across 9 states. Rhodes leads the development and execution of Essentialâ€™s strategic initiatives, with an emphasis on growth. Additionally, he is responsible for the organizationâ€™s overall corporate development, including acquisitions and divestitures of regulated and market-based (non-utility) businesses, and over-sees operations of all the market-based businesses.Â Since joining the organization, Rhodes has led numerous acquisitions and nearly doubled the companyâ€™s customer base. 
 
Professional History:
Rhodes was named to his current role upon joining Aqua America (the predecessor to Essential) in June 2018.Â Rhodes joined Aqua America after 11 years in the investment banking division at Goldman Sachs, as a managing director in the global natural resources group.Â Rhodes led the coverage effort for more than 25 electric and gas utility clients, and executed numerous M&A and financing transactions totaling over $100 billion of value. Prior to Goldman Sachs, Rhodes worked at Bank of America and Duke Capital Partners, focusing on oil and gas lending and investing.
 
Civic Engagement:
Along with the Delaware County Chamber of Commerce, Rhodes serves on the Board of the Bryn Mawr Hospital Foundation along with the Executive Board of Common Denominator, which provides free one-on-one math tutoring to disadvantaged middle school children.
 
Education:
Rhodes received a B.A. in finance from the University of Texas, Austin and an M.B.A. with Honors from the Stern School of business at New York University. 
 
#DelcoBiz #DelawareCounty

column8:
Still feeling invigorated by my recent visit to Seoul, Korea earlier this month, where I joined Brian McNamara, Tamara Rogers and Keith Choy in meeting the local team and exploring local stores â€“ not to mention experiencing the fantastic hospitality, culture and food!
 
It was a fascinating trip, particularly given the impact that the young, vibrant population is having on consumer trends and spending with the rise of K-culture and content. Korean music, movies, cuisine, design and cosmetics are growing in popularity and influence, not just locally but around the world. These Korean consumer goods and content are being amplified by social media and are increasingly being sold through e-commerce platforms. For Haleon, there are many learnings for us to take from this, with South Korea being the market holding the greatest e-comm share of business, and easily demonstrating how cultural trends can shape consumer behaviours across multiple sectors and markets.
 
Thank you Mari Nogami, @Charlie Shin, and the full Haleon Korea team for showing us around and giving us such a warm welcome!

As weâ€™ve come to the end of Pride Month, Iâ€™m filled with immense pride and gratitude. As a proud ally and advocate of the LGBTQIA+ community, I want to wish everyone a happy Pride as celebrations continue across the world in the coming weeks and months.

It has been inspiring to witness so many of colleagues at Haleon come together over the last month to celebrate. Their efforts to promote awareness and foster a deeper understanding of the ongoing challenges faced by the community donâ€™t go unnoticed. As a new business weâ€™re very much at the beginning of our journey and thereâ€™s more for us to do, but weâ€™re committed to nurturing an inclusive environment where every individual feels valued, understood, and treated equitably.

My passion for the impact we can achieve, both collectively and individually, is unwavering. It requires continuous action and active allyship, which involves engaging in meaningful conversations, confronting biases, seeking knowledge, and celebrating our diverse viewpoints. 

Iâ€™m incredibly proud of all four of our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) dedicated to gender, ethnicity, LGBTQIA+ and disability. The members, in addition to their regular roles, go above and beyond to positively impact the lives of colleagues worldwide and contribute to empowering our employees and sparking further transformation.

Letâ€™s take a moment to celebrate and appreciate the strides weâ€™ve made and the strides we will continue to make. Together, we stand in solidarity, not just during Pride Month but throughout the entire year.

#Haleon #Pride

Marlena Murphy, MA, LAPC, NCC was a tireless advocate for diversity in clinical trails, patients' digital rights, peer support, and cancer navigation for communities. Her smile lit up every room and meeting. Cancer stole you too  soon.

Marlena joined meetings during her treatment appointments and from her doctor appts as The Light Collective worked on our AI Rights for Patients draft. 

Marlena knew her time on this earth was limited and yet she actively showed up to ensure that the unmet needs of the patient communities she supported were represented in our work. Marlena dedicated her life's work to make healthcare a better place for all patients.

Marlena, I'm so blessed to have known you, to have learned from you, to have collaborated with you. My heart goes out to the GRASP community for their deep loss. 

Rest peacefully and in power. I know you and Casey Quinlan H.U.M.A.N.ðŸŒŸ are reunited, hopefully sailing and laughing with a bourbon in hand.

column8: Iâ€™m happy to share that Iâ€™ve been promoted to Director - Retail Bank Deposit Pricing & Product Strategy at Capital One!

This month is my 2-year anniversary of quitting GS to launch my startup. Here's how I made and got comfortable with the decision. 

1. Got honest about my personal trajectory and how many times I could gamble (potentially lose) and have to go back. At 42 years old I decided it was once so I better hurry. 

2. Assed my career momentum. It was speeding up and quickly arriving at the point of no-return (ie., in a few years' time it will be much harder to walk away from my comp and title).

3. Cost of living. I wanted to dedicate 1 year to the startup so I figured out how much bare bones expenses I had to cover. I was surprised at how low that number felt to me (about $80k) and that got me really excited. 

What it's been like over the last 2 years is another post. ðŸ˜…

I recently took my atv to Jason Miller who owns JKL Off-road in West Jordan. JKL is a locally owned, full service garage that was awesome to work with. Jason takes tremendous pride in his work and was super down to earth. His prices were very fair and the work was quick. He even offered to drop my machine off at my house!! Who does that?!?. 

If you are looking for someone to service your atv,utv,bikes, etc, give Jason a call. You will quickly see why I posted this!!

You can find their contact details online.

Thank you all for the support in my last post about my 2-year anniversary from quitting and going full-time on my startup. If you're interested, here are 3 things I learned in those 2 years:

1. Shawshanked - Just like Brooks and Redd when they get out of prison, life outside the corporate world actually made less sense to me. Being "inside" gave me structure, a community, and a feeling of belonging that I didn't know I would miss. I went from hundreds of emails and 8 hours of meetings a day to....nothing. Silence. It was a crushing loss of purpose that I never expected.

2. Lost at Sea - I love the phrase "to discover new worlds you must first lose sight of the shore". It's extremely romantic. But it's actually terrifying to no longer have any measurable feedback or response to your efforts. We laugh at performance review culture, but man, I had no idea how disorienting it would be to lose consistent feedback. Or how lonely. 

3. Time - I would have, and literally did, trade hundreds of thousands of dollars for more time. Then all of a sudden I had too much of it. So much, that all the opportunities and possibilities that came with it imploded and collapsed on themselves as I experienced an almost crippling sense of being overwhelmed by them. Like all resources, value is often a function of scarcity. 

This really all boils down to one lesson: learning to live with myself. I have to learn to be alone, to be proud of my efforts despite no external barometer of whether they matter. Maybe that's the real success? If I ever get there...

My son and husband have been dedicated to this project for the past two years. It's their hobby and passion, so weekends and holidays were spent bringing it to life. Watching their progress has been fascinating, and the first test drive left me speechless.

âœ… You might notice the BMW M5 in the background, a project now in its fourth year, which they plan to complete over the next year. But this post is all about the Maserati.

âœ… About the Car: This is a 2011 Maserati Quattroporte Sport GTS, the highest performance version of the 5th generation Quattroporte, and the only generation designed directly with influence from the legendary Luca Di Montezemolo. The late model year Gen 5 Quattroportes feature a wet sump 4.7L cross-plane crank version of the V8 from the Ferrari California and F430, internally designated as the F136. The Sport GTS boasts unique visual touches such as red accents on badges, oval exhaust tips, and special interior details. Mechanically, it has a louder exhaust, more reliable Bilstein coilovers, and 10 extra horsepower.

âœ… Maserati produced only 1,847 of these cars, making them extremely rare. Our car stands out even more with its Cuoio interior, as most Sport GTS models typically had black interiors. My son and husband repaired the AC and updated the head unit to include Apple CarPlay. They also replaced many interior components that the previous owner had tampered with.

âœ… One production this vehicle has starred in was *The Intouchables*. It featured this exact model and was part of what inspired this vehicleâ€™s purchase along with Jason Cammisa video on the Hagerty YouTube channel over this model. Overall, the elegance, power, and exotic underpinnings combined with a beautiful Pininfarina designed styling make the 5th generation Maserati Quattroporte a true legend.

Post writing credit: Ali Aziz

column8:
It's hard to believe that this week marks 15 years since Alexis Fogel, Jean Guillou, Bernard Liautaud, Emmanuel Schalit and I launched Dashlane. In the beginning, it was a school project at CentraleSupÃ©lec, with just a few of us working in a cold, windowless printing shop in the basement of the ESCP Business School, trying to create something that would make users' digital lives easier.

When we first set out, we weren't looking to create a password manager. Our first idea was a virtual personal assistant which would automate tasks online such as monitoring your bank account or making purchases. As we were working on different prototypes, we realized that we had to be very focused in order to do one thing well, instead of many things poorly.

We also realized that the tasks we wanted to automate all started with authentication, so we eventually honed in on password management. This netted us $5M in Series A funding. This was a lot back then, or at least we thought.

In those early days, the pace of work was frenetic. We were coding from morning until night, and on weekends. We pushed a lot of code to production at once, and things broke. But it's that pace of innovation which allowed us to get to where we are today.

Through the years, three people with interns in a cold basement turned into 30 people having pizza at the office most days, then into 150 people celebrating our 10th year anniversary. Fast forward to today, there are more than 300 Dashlaners working to deliver the credential security that every business and employee needs to thrive. 

Weâ€™ve now grown to secure the credentials - passwords, passkeys, and secrets - of more than 23,000 organizations and millions of consumers. Weâ€™ve taken the lessons learned from our consumer heritage to provide the workforce fast and secure access to applications, and to give IT admins tools for proactive breach protection. We're also leading the push towards confidential computing use in credential management, and are deeply involved in building a passwordless future.

Credential management has evolved into so much more than facilitating good password hygiene. Attacks targeting the user are growing in both frequency and sophistication, and so organizations today are recognizing that credential security is not a nice-to-have, but a foundational part of their tech stack.

We've only begun to explore what's possible in our space. There's more coming soon.

Happy birthday, Dashlane!

column8: Exciting update!

A common argument against investing in #naturalgas is that we should not "lock in" more fossil fuel infrastructure. Others say it will become a stranded asset. 

The claims are dubious.

In fact, consumers and the broader market are disproving them on a daily basis.

Last year, Washington Governor Jay Inslee (D) criticized federal approval of a natural gas pipeline because he said it "locks in long-term capital investments" in gas and will become a "costly stranded asset." In 2022, California announced a "review" of pipelines to "avoid stranded assets" and which "advances our transition away from natural gas." The Illinois Commerce Commission recently initiated its own "Future of Gas" proceedings with concerns about "stranded assets" and the need for so-called "non-pipeline alternatives" to new gas investments.

But households and other consumers are telling a completely different story: we want gas.

The U.S. natural gas system adds a new customer every minute. Polls also consistently show that Americans have no interest in banning #gasstoves or creating other restrictions on consumer choice. 

American families don't seem concerned about locking in delivery of the affordable fuel they want. 

Many have spent years just trying to get access. In Taos County, NM, residents waited decades to get connected to the natural gas system. This past spring, developers announced a pipeline project was finally moving forward. 

"We're excited for it," a local tribal leader said. "We've been working on it since 2006-2007, trying to get natural gas up this way." Estimates show switching to natural gas will save local customers $1,800 per year, a massive relief for a county where the median household income is 25% below the national average.

Last week, Reuters reported that U.S. power generators burned a record amount of natural gas as temperatures rose and air conditioning needs soared. And as Richard Meyer recently pointed out, based on data from the U.S. EIA, natural gas â€“ already the top fuel for power generation nationally â€“ is on the verge of becoming the top primary energy source in the United States.

The president of the New England Power Generators Association recently explained that when the region has closed coal- or oil-fired generation, it's not typically being replaced by wind or solar. It's being replaced by natural gas. 

Globally, the picture is similar. Worldwide #LNG trade hit an all-time high in 2023. In an analysis released this month, the International Energy Agency said global natural gas demand increased (again) in the first half of 2024.

Claims about "stranded assets" and avoiding fossil fuel "lock in" reflect a disregard for what consumers actually want. The only way these assets will become "stranded" is if the same advocates making those claims successfully lobby for policies to restrict gas. The market is moving toward more natural gas, not less.

Demand matters.

(Image: https://lnkd.in/exkgZJSg)

What do you think of â€œeffectivenessâ€?

As I read the ranking below, a question popped: can you look at effectiveness in isolation? ðŸï¸ 

While Effie Worldwide highlights some strong achievements (link in first comment, congrats to all companies on the list!), itâ€™s crucial to remember that effectiveness is just one piece of the puzzle ðŸ§© 

To truly maximize the value of marketing investments, we must consider the holy trio of media:

ðŸŒ Reach. It determines the total number of people our message reaches within a specific brand target group
ðŸ’° Efficiency. It assesses the quality audiences reached per dollar spent, ensuring maximum reach within budget
ðŸ›’ Effectiveness. It measures the conversion rate in terms of sales driven for each of the people reached

Research by McKinsey & Company suggests that brands focusing on all three metrics together see an average of 1.5x higher revenue growth compared to those focusing on effectiveness alone ðŸ“Š

All week, Iâ€™ve been overwhelmed by the many employees who have come up to me and congratulated me on my 10th anniversary of being the president and CEO of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. This wasnâ€™t a job I ever envisioned for myself, but itâ€™s one Iâ€™ve loved doing. 

When I was younger, I discovered my â€œsuperpower.â€ Even if I wasnâ€™t the smartest, quickest, or most talented in the room, I could outwork almost anyone. However, once I became president and CEO of St. Jude, I quickly learned that I couldnâ€™t outwork my team. 

Over the past decade, we have made seismic changes at St. Jude, expanding our campus, our progress, and our global reach to fulfill the mission of advancing cures, and means of prevention, for pediatric catastrophic diseases through research and treatment. We are incorporating cutting-edge technologies in labs and clinics, increasing our fundamental scientific research exponentially, and growing our workforce by 40% over six years. 

None of the successes weâ€™ve seen in the past 10 years would be possible without the dedication and tireless efforts of the many employees, partners and donors of St. Jude.

Iâ€™m humbled and grateful to continue leading this institution as we pursue our mission of finding cures and saving children, not only in Memphis but everywhere.
Honored to lead with this great group.

I can't believe the Data Collaboration Summit we co-hosted with Stanislas Lajouanie from LiveRamp in Paris was already one month ago! 
This 3rd edition was incredible with some of the smartest minds and most advanced companies on the topic of Retail Media and Data Collaboration coming from everywhere to speak and attend.

We explored crucial themes in data collaboration:
- Asmita Dubey, CDMO of L'OrÃ©al, shared how their data-driven strategy fuels their "Beauty for each, powered by Beauty Tech" approach, revolutionizing the beauty industry.
- We learned how data is central to the organization of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, optimizing everything from ticket bookings to athlete departures, public transportation, and luggage management.
- The latest best-in-class use cases in retail media were explored, highlighting synergies between TikTok, Connected TV, and advanced measurement methods.
- Practical steps to accelerate in data collaboration were discussed, emphasizing the importance of shared learning agendas, culture alignment, and measurement standardization.

I'm incredibly proud of our Numberly team for bringing together such thought-provoking leaders and fostering rich discussions that will undoubtedly shape the future of our industry.
Feel free to watch the replays of this great summit on our website: https://lnkd.in/eqY5aVtp

I have been in telehealth since 2013 and there is and never has been a 'hatred' against those questioning its utility with evidence. 

Medicine, by definition, requires constant evaluation. At both a macro and individual/micro level. We research to improve what we know, to understand what is happening to our patients and populations and what we can do about it. The goal is to figure out how to do better. Improve our health to its fullest for the time we have. 

Part of our oath is promising to respect the scientific gains of our peers. Because we don't know everything. New discoveries are made all the time. Whether in the lab or in processes. 

Questioning is part of the contract. This is why we don't practice the way we did even 5 years ago, much less 100 years ago. We learn and adapt. That is how science works. 

Like any area of medicine, #telemedicine is subject to the same requirements. Asking questions, researching the answers and disseminating that information is necessary to improve what we know. Pushback on change is not an outright denunciation of it. It is a call and request to do it better so we can utilize it effectively. 

That is what Ateev Mehrotra was and has been doing. I'll give you an example. An oft cited article from 2017 in Health Affairs demonstrated that #telehealth increased healthcare #utilization and, in turn, increased #costs. 

What do telehealth advocates do with that information? We had two options: 
1) Throw in the towel 
Or
2) Do what we did and ask the requisite follow-up. How do we bring down those costs? Can we show a different ROI? Do patients getting seen earlier improve downstream costs? Are there other benefits to telehealth that balance this out? 

Also, there is only cooperation. Lori Uscher-Pines was a co-author on that paper and worked with us at Jefferson for awhile. Because everyone had the same goal of improving care. 

In a more recent paper, looking at #antibiotic prescriptions for #pediatrics demonstrated less prescriptions in a #hybrid telemedicine and #primarycare model. Knowing this can lead to better care models, #QA and antibiotic stewardship. 

Medicine and healthcare benefits when we have the discourse. When we pushback and figure out what is right and works. 

The research has also started to show improvements in care and costs when it previously had only shown equivocal care or worsening. Probably because we learnt. 

I cannot stress enough what a small world telehealth was in the beginning. We all generally worked toward the same goals. Naysayers were not unusual, it was the norm. The pandemic changed some but not all of that. Instead there is another focus and potential villain for the #healthtech changes we are implementing. 

No matter. Those digital health solutions will be evaluated in the same manner. 

And if we have to re-evaluate as this goes to #CMS? Great. It is part of the process. Let's make it better. 

#digitalhealth #medicine #futureofhealth

Today, I am excited to share that we are launching #TheLatinoLeadershipAcademy, an online training program that will prepare Latinos to step up to executive positions as the nation faces an imminent and unprecedented talent gap. Twenty million people are expected to retire over the next 10 years. That means we are already in the throes of a tectonic workforce change that will affect every sectorâ€”public, private, and nonâ€”profitâ€”and will create an enormous talent gap. 

The Latino Leadership Academy consists of 6 high-quality online courses for individuals and corporations.Â The programming covers personal, professional, and leadership development for Latinos and Allies. It is primarily designed for professionals aspiring to access senior-level positions. 

Thank you to my partners Perla Tamez Casasnovas and Robert Rodriguez, PhD for joining me in this project and sharing your singular expertise in talent development.

This program couldn't be a reality without the support of the Leadership Skills Institute and Nancy Spears' incredible platform, genconnectU.

We have begun deploying a network of high-resolution video cameras using artificial intelligence (AI) technology to provide enhanced situational awareness and early detection of ignitions in elevated fire risk areas near company infrastructure. The public will also have access to the live feeds from any of the cameras.

Our crews recently installed the first camera station in Lahaina and has plans to deploy a total of 78 stations in elevated fire risk areas on the five islands served by the company, with each location having two cameras to provide a full 360-degree view. The camera feeds will be monitored 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The $14 million project is the latest step in our ongoing effort to reduce the risk of wildfires associated with company equipment. 

â€œWe are continuing to take action to address the growing risks from wildfires across our service territory using a variety of technologies and methods,â€ said Jim Alberts, Hawaiian Electric senior vice president and chief operations officer. â€œInstalling publicly viewable AI-assisted video cameras in elevated fire risk areas will enable the company, fire agencies, and emergency operations centers the ability to identify potential wildfires early and respond quickly.â€

We have signed a five-year contract with California-based ALERTWest. ALERTWestâ€™s software platform, which is widely used in fire-prone areas through the Western U.S., is assisted by AI to detect smoke and other early indications of fire in real-time. It was developed by ALERTWest in collaboration with UC San Diegoâ€™s ALERTCalifornia team, California utilities, and the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (CAL FIRE). ALERTWest also recently partnered with the University of Oregon and the University of Nevada, Reno, creating the largest publicly available, interoperable, AI wildfire detection system in the United States. The system is assisted by AI to detect smoke and other early indications of fire in real time, day and night. This allows first responders and emergency personnel to cross state boundaries in mutual aid situations and have access to the tool when needed.The AI Solution was recognized as one of TIMEâ€™s best inventions of 2023.

The public will be able to access the live feeds from any of the cameras on the ALERTWest website at https://alertwest.live/. Half of the video camera stations are expected to be operational by September 2024, with the remainder to be installed in the first half of 2025.

Read more: https://lnkd.in/dS3s8cBc

Exciting news: Tanja Oquendo, JD, is joining Fairview as our new chief people officer (CPO), effective Aug. 12. Oquendo brings extensive human resources experience to Fairview and has demonstrated success shaping employee engagement and workplace culture.

Prior to joining Fairview, Oquendo was chief administrative officer, chief human resources officer, and system senior vice president of transformation and integration at Chicago-based CommonSpirit Health, one of the nationâ€™s largest nonprofit healthcare systems. As CPO, Oquendo will help drive Fairview forward by leading efforts that promote culture, diversity, equity, inclusion, and organizational growth. She champions people-first strategies that help organizations exceed goals related to quality, safety, customer service, and engagement.

This is a big week in womenâ€™s pro sports.  When product, market and marketing come together it equals economic power. 

The WNBA rights package and the Angel City record valuation shows itâ€™s possible. And we have only just begun. 

* The womenâ€™s pro product and talent is at an all time high, and the next generation is inspired to reach and train harder. 

*The market fit is strong and will grow as the next generation of viewers see athletes without bias or limits, and without labels such as male or female athletes. 

* Fans are leaning in and want more, and more, and more. And now they will be able to watch and follow like never before. 

There is so much opportunity today, tomorrow and tomorrow. 

Bravo to the WNBA, the NWSL and ACFC.

Every #user deserves a #safe #trusted interaction with any website, mobile app or webapp they use. The #experience should be super #easy and available on their most favorite mobile or personal device that they use to #login to those applications. 

We believe going #passwordless in seamless and simple way is the way to turn that into reality. And yes, there have been many companies and standards  (#CISA #MFA #FIDO #passkeys #OpenID and more) over years that have tried to grow that adoption and have not reached that point where we stop seeing passwords based thefts and breaches. 

The podcast below explains:
(1) what is #passwordless , 
(2) how to make it easy to adopt (step by step implementation) #passwordless in a language that any non-cyber expert can also understand and implement, and
(3) how Hawcx is helping in that journey

Thank You Cybercrime Magazine Steve Morgan for this discussion and Riya Shanmugam for this opportunity 

https://lnkd.in/gfWfqTrS

Selva Kumaraswamy

#cybersecurity #Safety #preventbreaches #identity #hawcx #passwordless

Travelling with the family to some well deserved time off!

At Mightier, we're here to help all members of the family so parents feel supported and kids can thrive. Each month, we put on a FREE webinar to provide activities, insights, and tips for parents and caregivers. 

This month, Mightier Associate Clinical Director, Jessica Ragnio dives into the world of mindfulness. Although a buzzword, itâ€™s ALSO a powerful tool for sensory integration, relieving feelings of stress and anxiety, and regulating our emotions.

We invite you or the parents and caregivers in your community to register for this FREE presentation ðŸ‘‰ https://hubs.la/Q02H0qWQ0

The most amazing product strategy and product roadmap are ineffective if the stakeholders donâ€™t support them. Without their buy-in, youâ€™ll struggle to execute the strategy and find it hard to deliver the roadmap.

But how can you secure stakeholder agreement without making weak compromises and resorting to design by committee? In my latest article, I share four tips to help you address this challenge:

1ï¸âƒ£ Involve the Right Stakeholders
Engage the individuals whose expertise and support you need to make the right decisions and successfully implement them.

2ï¸âƒ£ Secure the Right Level of Buy-in
Unanimity for a new or significantly changed product strategy and consent for smaller strategy changes and roadmap decisions.

3ï¸âƒ£ Co-create the Product Strategy and Roadmap 
Jointly create and evolve the product strategy and roadmap instead of presenting the plans to the stakeholders and convincing them to agree with the plans.

4ï¸âƒ£ Help Stakeholders Meet their Commitments
Donâ€™t ignore the issue if a stakeholder does not follow the product strategy or roadmap they have agreed to. Offer constructive feedback instead by using my feedback framework.

I hope you'll find my advice helpful. Let me know your thoughts and questions in the comments!

#productmanagement #productstrategy #productroadmap #stakeholdermanagement

Stranded in London airport with hundreds of thousands of people, with no ETA in sight for flight take-offs because of a major Microsoft outage which seems to have been caused by an update CrowdStrike pushed for its Falcon product. The update seems to cause every endpoint (server, PC, VM) to experience a blue screen of death!Â  Airlines, hospital surgeries, banks etc. are all being affected globally.Â  A reminder of how a disruption to single critical software
can lead to significant economic disruption. I can only imagine the level of stress of all the engineers and on-call teams who are working on this right now. Rooting for you guys to solve this quicklyâ€”you've got this! Can't wait to get back home!

Regardless of our political affinities, Taiwan is currently an essential country for the free world and the United States economy. Taiwan did not "stealâ€ the #semiconductors industry from the US. It is the American companies that decided to outsource the fabs of the most advanced semis to TSMC.
Taiwan also spends a significant part of its GDP on defense. 
As I said several times, 95% of advanced semis are manufactured by TSMC and Samsung, underscoring the technological talent of Taiwanese and South Korean people. Intel Corporation is trying to bring back semi-fabs in the US but is punished savagely by a myopic Wall Street that cares only about an easy buck and not about our country's national #security. In the last few days, Wall Street sold semiconductor companies, causing huge losses to companies and retail investors just because it heard some words. 
The free world and the US need Taiwan to prosper economically and be independent.
The Wall Street Journal The New York Times

Fifteen years ago today, I joined a cult - the running community. Completing my first half marathon felt impossible, yet there I was, pushing through mile 10 in the Napa to Sonoma race, with my wife Ann's unwavering support.

Eight half marathons later with the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation Team Challenge program, we'd raised over $100k for a cause close to my heart. The Team Challenge Family, along with Ann, became an incredible support system, even leading to an unforgettable meeting with Rolf Benirschke, former NFL kicker, IBD warrior and my hero.

The struggle to complete these races mirrors leading a startup. Nike's "Just Do It" sparks initial efforts, but it's the character built over years that sustains you. The resilience I developed through thousands of training miles, and Ann's constant encouragement, now fuel my entrepreneurial journey.

As I navigate the ups and downs of startup life, I'm reminded of those final miles. The finish line may seem distant, but each step builds something meaningful.

What challenges have prepared you for your current role? How do you apply those lessons?

#Startup #StartupLife #Fundraising #NonProfit #Crohns #IBD #TCFamily

Itâ€™s surreal to say Iâ€™m leaving GLG after 20 amazing years.

In summer of 2004, I walked into 850 3rd Avenue in New York in a baggy suit and with hair to start work at Gerson Lehrman Group. The place was electric.

Little did I know then that Iâ€™d find a place to grow for two decades. 

GLG was a novel idea. 1:1 learning with experts clearly resonated with investors. By the time I joined, the company had broken through the startup phase, yet we knew the opportunity was much bigger.Â There were thousands more professionals, scientists, and former public officials with expertise to share.Â And we could improve decision-making at all sorts of organizations.

Over the years, we pioneered the expert economy. Our leaders built a culture of doing things the right way, not taking shortcuts. And we made magic through millions of matches. GLG is 10x bigger than when I started, and I had the opportunity to go from a young contributor and team leader to the executive team. The company continues to innovate, and AI is a tailwind.

LinkedIn can show you the connections Iâ€™ve made, the roles I had, and where I lived.

What LinkedIn canâ€™t tell you is how much I learned.

It canâ€™t tell you the extraordinary impact so many of you had on me. I always loved how we were competitive externally but collaborative internally. I had the privilege to help serve some of the best investors in the world and savvy strategy consultants. And I benefitted from amazing managers, peers willing to share, and ambitious teams around me. Iâ€™ve particularly enjoyed seeing so many teammates grow and take on exciting roles at GLG and beyond. 

LinkedIn also cannot tell you how much fun I had. 

Heck, I even met my wife through the GLG network, thanks to a colleagueâ€™s introduction.

Whatâ€™s next?

Iâ€™ve decided to become a GLG client! 

Together with two Partners and support from early GLGers and others, weâ€™ve launched an investment firm, Switchback Capital LLC. 

I will introduce Switchback and more detail on our first two portfolio companies, Smokey Mo's BBQ and Carlisle Wide Plank Floors, in the weeks to come.

Iâ€™ve been inspired meeting and learning from so many incredible GLG experts. And like our smartest clients, we will leverage GLG even more systematically at Switchback to grow our business and our portfolio companies.

It takes more characters than LinkedIn allows to thank everyone who gave me chances and mentored me, and made my time at GLG such a joy.

Thank you all!

I just returned from co-hosting a week-long wedding for my eldest daughter Amanpreet Samra! It was an incredible week where all our family from the UK, Canada, and all over the USA came together, as well as our closest friends to be a part of the wedding, and equally, spend quality time with one another! As some of you may well know, Sikh weddings are full of rich traditions, ceremonies, festivities and dancing! My son-in-law, Jonathan Bernardo, CIMAÂ® is of Italian descent which added to the diversity of the wedding, and we were pleased to see how the two families came together to celebrate their love, with mutual respect for the respective faiths & cultures.

I was humbled by the love and support for the beautiful couple, and our family. I especially enjoyed the informal gatherings at our home, and of course the formal events where the detailed planning (Sonal J. Shah) was appreciated by all. We had been planning for this wedding for over a year, a major project! It was an exhilarating week that surpassed all our expectations, and we feel very blessed!

We all work hard â€¦ and it is moments like this that remind you what is most important in life. #Family, #love and #relationships! I am grateful for having the means to host a beautiful wedding for my daughter, and the love we have all around us.

Thank you! #bettertogether

The photos below provide a glimpse of what the week was like â€¦
This week 2 years ago we listed on the London Stock Exchange - what a 2 years it has been!  Too many memories to share and so many good ones shared with great people.  Here is to many more Haleon!

My favorite role in the world is the role that I am privileged to play as mom. My oldest and I have been at the Turner Syndrome Society of the United States annual conference this weekend. It is a beautiful community that rallies around this rare disease.

If you are not familiar with TS, it is a complex genetic disorder that occurs in 1-2% of conceptions, and only 1% of those survive through pregnancy. My daughter is extraordinary, as are all the other girls and women who are living with Turner Syndrome.

Like most rare diseases, research for Turner Syndrome is severely underfunded. We must continue to push groups like The National Institutes of Health to ensure Turner Syndrome and other diseases that disproportionately affect women receive more funding. There is still so much to learn.

column8:
A five-level roadmap to track the creation of AI that surpasses human capabilities was recently laid down by OpenAI. This classification system aims to clarify our journey towards Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).

Current Level: 
ðŸ”¹ Level 1 - Conversational AI: This is the AI we interact with today, such as ChatGPT, which excels at human-like conversations. These systems can engage in natural dialogue, demonstrating a foundational understanding and the ability to respond to a wide range of prompts and questions.

Next Level: 
ðŸ”¹ Level 2 - Reasoners: These AI systems will be capable of solving complex problems with the proficiency of human experts. These systems perform problem-solving tasks at the level of a PhD-educated individual, without access to external resources. This represents a significant leap from mimicking human behavior to demonstrating genuine intellectual prowess. We are currently on the cusp of achieving this level.

Future Levels: 
ðŸ”¹ Level 3 - Agents: At this stage, AI systems will operate autonomously for extended periods, taking actions on a userâ€™s behalf. These agents will handle complex tasks, make decisions, and adapt to changing circumstances without constant human oversight, representing a major advancement in AI autonomy and practical utility.

ðŸ”¹ Level 4 - Innovators: AI systems at this level will be capable of developing groundbreaking ideas and solutions across various fields. This stage signifies AIâ€™s ability to drive innovation and progress independently, pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible.

ðŸ”¹ Level 5 - Organizations: AI systems functions as entire entities, managing complex operations, strategic thinking, and adaptability. These AI organizations will have the capability to oversee and execute tasks that currently require human management and coordination.

This structured framework provides a clear pathway toward AGI, setting measurable milestones to track progress. AI researchers have debated the criteria for achieving AGI for years. These frameworks are akin to the automotive industryâ€™s system for assessing self-driving cars' automation levels.

We can expect AI advancements that bring us closer to a future where AI systems can perform and innovate at levels beyond human potential within this decade.

column8: Today was a tough day for most CIOâ€™s. What I learned today is that in situations like this, it still comes down to the leadership basics: exhibiting calmness amongst the chaos, focus and prioritize on what matters most, openness and transparency in communication, guiding your team in what has to get done but constantly encouraging and thanking them for going above and beyond along the way, tight strategic vendor partnerships, best practice sharing amongst peers, and lessons learned if this were ever to happen again, God forbid. Feel free to add

Addendum: So much better to figure out how to engage and harness your competition rather than going to war, which steals your energy and focus. (And gives people a reason to move from neutral to negative on you!) There's nothing less worthy of your time than a petty, puny antagonist. Thank you, next.

(Adding to comments as I get more info) Heads-up: Iâ€™m hearing now that cyber threat actors may be posing as â€œCrowdStrike supportâ€ and reaching out to â€œoffer helpâ€. BE SURE YOUâ€™RE TALKING TO CRWD.

CrowdStrike Chief Executive George Kurtz said in a post on X that the issue had been identified and a fix had been deployed, adding that â€œthis is not a security incident or cyberattack.â€

column8:
After serving 10 years in the Global War on Terror, with 6 years boots on ground in Iraq and Afghanistan, transitioning back to civilian life wasn't easy. My first foray into business nearly led me to bankruptcy, but I didn't give up. Instead, I chose to invest in myself and my future by using the GI Bill to pursue education in my 30s.

Despite the prevailing sentiment these days that education is a waste of time, my experience was quite the opposite. Going back to school was a challenging journey, but it proved to be the best decision I ever made. It provided me with the knowledge, skills, and resilience needed to rebuild my career and succeed in the tech and defense industries. I used to carry a machine gun, and now I sit at a keyboard, demonstrating that the skills and discipline from the battlefield translate well into the classroom and beyond.

Education has made all the difference for me. Itâ€™s a powerful tool for personal and professional growth, and I firmly believe itâ€™s always a good choice. As long as opportunities for learning are available, I will relentlessly pursue them. To anyone doubting the value of education, I encourage you to take that step. The investment in yourself is always worth it.

#Education #LifelongLearning #Veterans #GIbill #NeverGiveUp

It excites me to know that nobody else is in control of my shit ...
except me.

If I created the issue, then I have the power to fix it. If I didnâ€™t create the issue and itâ€™s bigger than me or purely circumstantial, I can still decide how I absorb it.

Whatever is bothering you right now, take a step back, be grateful for what is going well, and realize what you can and canâ€™t control.

If you canâ€™t control something, let it go and focus on what you can control, which is how much and how often you deploy gratitude in your life.

Itâ€™s not just about having gratitude â€“ you have to show it.

It is not AI but Humans that shine during a crisis!

The recent CrowdStrike incident highlighted the indispensable role of technology in our daily lives. Thousands of IT teams worldwide diligently worked to restore systems, setting a new standard for IT excellence. Reflecting on the past 18-20 hours, I am inspired by our team's resilience, adaptability, but most notably, their human touch. 

Amidst restoring systems, our team showcased camaraderie through jokes, laughter, and supportive guidance. Intellectual debates flourished, showcasing diverse perspectives without hierarchical barriers. The team's empathy towards their business counterparts highlighted a truly human-centric approach. 

I am privileged to be part of this exceptional team, where human kindness and compassion reign supreme. Your tireless efforts, creative solutions, clear communication, and unwavering dedication are truly commendable. 

No AI in the world could replace your human kindness and compassion for each other.Â YOU are the secret sauce that makes National Life Group so unique. You rock!

Honored and Proud to be in the company of my three close friends & batchmates (1978-83) Anil Gupta, Shishir Joshipura, and Sanjeev Tirath, who have been honored with BITS distinguish Alumni award 2024.

Couple of interesting facts: 
- 1st time 4 people from the same batch got BITS Distinguished Award in the same year.
- Shishir Joshipura and I have been studying together since 6th grade. 
Same school (Mahavir School), Same City (Jaipur) and the same hostel (Shankar Bhavan). 11 of us from the same class at Mahavir School went to BITS Pilani in 1978. 
- Many people may not know but my first startup was with the other two gentlemen Anil Gupta and Sanjeev Tirath. We all started a company named "STACS" in 1984 (System Technology and Consulting Services). Many other people Sanjeev Gupta, Ashok Kumar, Divyavir Rastogi, Ramesh Pandey, Namita Gupta, Sanjeev Sood helped in this endeavor. We did probably one of the early digitization projects for "Gendamal Hemraj" the famous shop on Mall Road Shimla and also developed first flight display system for the Delhi airport among others. While all of us went out different ways, Anil Gupta (Jaat) kept STACS going and later started Microtek and Okaya. Tirath went to US and started Pyramid Consulting. Shishir led important companies like Thermax, SKF and now Praj.
- Rajasthan got severe floods (Can you believe it) in 1978 and we had a very exciting time in reaching from Jaipur to Pilani (That story for some other time ðŸ˜Š 

Congratulations to all the BITS Distinguished award winners.
Proud to be among friends and in the company of outstanding accomplishers.

Prof. V Ramgopal Rao Chandra Shekhar Sudhirkumar V Barai Vinod (Vin) Dham Sailesh Chittipeddi Prith Banerjee Naveed Sherwani Navin Bishnoi Srikanth Settikere Abhay Karandikar Director BITS Pilani - K.K. Birla Goa Campus Soumyo Mukherji Sanket Goel Harish Bhat Arya Kumar Rajat Moona Sitharam T.G Manoj Choudhary, PhD Veerappan VV Jaswinder Ahuja Subhash Chintamaneni Manoranjan (Mao) Mohapatra Prashanth Palakurthi Deepak Bhardwaj Dinesh Ramanathan Jitendra Chaddah (JC) Nishit Gupta Sagar Sharma Chitra Hariharan Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani BITS Pilani Alumni Relations Official VLSI Society of India (VSI) India Electronics and Semiconductor Association India Semiconductor Mission Electronics India For You

I had an incredible time at the Centene Corporation Intern Summit in St. Louis this past week! It was an invaluable experience, filled with networking, insightful conversations with executives, and significant personal and professional growth. Iâ€™m extremely grateful for the opportunity to learn from and connect with such inspiring individuals!

We had the privilege of hearing from an exceptional panel of executives, including our remarkable CEO, Sarah M. London. Her insights and leadership are truly inspiring, especially as she is recognized as the youngest female CEO of a Fortune 25 company. It was also an honor to hear from Tanya McNally , Brian LeClaire , Shannon Thornton Susko , Susan Smith and Alice Hm Chen.  Having leaders of such importance and power take the time to speak with us was truly motivating and showed their commitment to our growth and development.

Also at the summit, we had the opportunity to build skateboards for Foster Love, an organization dedicated to improving the lives of children in foster care. 

Kelley Peters, VP of Public Health & Foster Care Operations, delivered a speech that truly resonated with me. Two things she said stood out: â€œYour voice is valuable, use it.â€ As someone who sometimes hesitates to speak up, it was empowering to hear this from someone in her position. She also emphasized the â€œPower of the Pause,â€ reminding us to pause and remember our mission and purpose. In our fast-paced company and world, it's crucial to take a moment to reflect on why we do what we do.

And a big thank you to Centene's University Relations team for planning such an amazing summit!

I am extremely proud to work for a company that prioritizes the well-being of individuals, one person at a time. #OneCenteam #Centene

Yesterday wrapped up what was an unforgettable experience at the Centene Corporation Intern Summit in St. Louis, Missouri! 

I had the chance to meet so many amazing people and I have grown so much from this experience. Connecting with fellow interns was a highlight, and it was inspiring to see the passion and dedication of everyone involved.

I had the privilege of meeting and engaging with some of the amazing leaders of Centene including Wade Rakes , Drew Asher, Tanya McNally, Brian LeClaire, Shannon Thornton Susko , Susan Smith and Alice Hm Chen. The fact that these leaders took the time to speak with us was not only motivating but it showed Centeneâ€™s commitment to growth and development. Their advice on making the most of our intern experience and careers was truly invaluable. They encouraged us to always be curious, go for what we want, and never back down.

One of the most meaningful parts of the summit was the community service project. We built skateboards for Foster Love an initiative that not only allowed us to give back to the community but also helped us further connect with our cohort for a good cause. This experience was deeply impactful, highlighting the importance of service, a core value at Centene.

The summit featured not only professional development workshops on networking, but also personal development sessions. I particularly enjoyed sessions on the value of knowing ourselves and understanding our unique personalities. These insights into self-awareness and improving interactions were incredibly enlightening.

Hearing from Sarah M. London , our incredible CEO and the youngest female CEO of the Fortune 500, was particularly inspiring to me as a young woman just starting my professional career. Her journey and passion for Centene and its mission were so motivating, leaving a lasting impression on me and encouraging me to push beyond my comfort zone and strive for nothing less than excellence.

I want to extend a huge thank you to the University Relations team and everyone involved for organizing such an amazing event. Their dedication and effort made this experience truly special. I am walking away with a wealth of knowledge, inspiration, and a renewed sense of purpose.

#CenteneIntern #InternSummit

This week, I had an amazing time attending the Intern Summit at the Centene Headquarters in St. Louis, Missouri.

I want to express my gratitude to Jon Dinesman for sharing insights on the importance of self-awareness and community involvement and to Zachary Wieder for conducting the Principle Assessment Personality Workshop.

It was a huge honor to hear from the exceptional CEO Sarah M. London and the executive team, including Brian LeClaire, Tanya McNally, Alice Hm Chen, Shannon Thornton Susko, and Susan Smith. 

During the summit, I had the opportunity to build skateboards for Foster Love, an organization dedicated to improving the lives of children in foster care. 

The summit was a transformative experience that allowed me to network with interns from diverse backgrounds and emphasized the value of curiosity, the importance of asking questions, effective networking, continuous learning, and finding passion in our work.

I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to Kelly Merkle (Litzelfelner) for providing me with this life-changing opportunity. I also want to express my deep appreciation to Winnie Tu, SHRM-CP, CDR, Evan Sanders, Allison Dietz, Imani Humphrey (MAHRM), Brandon Brown, Rami Issawi, MBA, and Morgan Schrier for their unwavering dedication and hard work in making the summit an unforgettable experience.

#CenteneIntern #OneCenTeam #curosity #accountability #trust #courage #service
